title: thunderbird supernova (115) - manual sorting of favorites within "favorite folders" view
content:
hi. just installed tb 113.0b6 on macOS ventura 13.3.1 (a) to check, if supernova will have the possibility to manually sort the favorites within the "favorite folders" view, but it seems, this possibility will still not be available.

in our company we have lots of shared imap folders which - within their category - have the same name like e.g. "project1/team", "project2/team", "project3/team". the categories "project1", "...2", "...3" are shown as subfolders of (my) personal account, so after flagging their resp. "team" folders as favorites they are displayed in "favorite folders" view with their name "team" only (without "project1", "...2", "...3" prefix), so i can't see, if one is "team" from "project1" or from "project2" etc., and currently in stable tb 102.10.1 as well as in 113.0b6 the "favorite folders" view only offers automatic alphabetical sorting resulting in a tree like this:

inbox ads google info support team team team youtube

all the "team" folders are sorted one after the other, but i'd like to move/sort in the second "team" folder right after "inbox" as it is a more important folder (for me) compared to the other two...

so, does anybody know more about this; will it maybe possible to manually sort favorites within "favorite folders" view following one's personal priorities in the final release 115? or is it at least on some to-do-list?

thanks a lot and kind regards, lyrabee
creator: lyrabee

title: OAuth2 "400 redirect_uri does not match the Callback URL"
content: Hello! Windows 11 22H2 22621.1555 + Thunderbird 102.10.1 (64-bit) I face a problem with Yandex mailbox with the following authentication settings: smtp.yandex.com:465 SSL/TLS OAuth2 The "Enter credentials" window gives --- 400 redirect_uri does not match the Callback URL defined for the client --- after logging into account. The address in the window is https://oauth.yandex.com/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=...&redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost&scope=mail%3Aimap_full I removed the client_id but "localhost" is authentic and suspicious. What can cause the problem?

title: THUNDERBIRD EMAIL
content:
Windows 7 Pro, Firefox 112.0.2 (64-bit), Thunderbird 102.10.1 (64-bit)

First Issue: -Thunderbird email was set up a month ago, imported 20G+ messages upon initiation, then imported per normal for a couple of weeks. -Hasn't imported new messages since 04-26-23. -Bellsouth account functioning normally on Yahoo.com website. -No settings have been changed on Bellsouth.net or Thunderbird.

Thunderbird Error Message when "get messages" is used. This happens several minutes after initiation, with the blue progress bar lit up the whole time: "The DELE command did not succeed. Error marking a message as deleted. Mail server inbound.att.net responded: Too many requests."

What does this mean? For one thing, I haven't deleted anything in Thunderbird or in Bellsouth.net since the Thunderbird account was set up that I know of.

Second Issue: Thunderbird has never imported Sent Mail (and other folders) from Bellsouth.net.

Thanks
creator: blwomble

title: After moving my profile on NAS server new mails get re-downloaded on every launch
content: Hi, I moved one of the profiles to my NAS server that all of the users have access to, on each PC I changed the path to the profile and poited it on said NAS. All clients loaded whole profile correctly, when I received any email it appeared on all devices at the same time, however upon closing and reopening TB the client redownloaded latest message again, displaying notification afterwards. This happens on every reopen with or without other users having TB open. Deleted emails are still visible on launch and disappear as soon as "new" emails are downloaded. Am I doing something wrong? Is there a way to correctly centralize the TB profile for multiple users? Thank you in advance
creator: 2manyads4me

If I want a different sending email address, I can just overwrite the preferred sending entry.

If not, could this idea be considered an enhancement for future versions of Thunderbird?

Many thanks

title: Thunderbird not saving Emails in any findable place
content:
I've moved Thunderbird several times with no problem transferring saved emails but I am now stymied. For years, I saved them in Documents/Thunderbird for easy backup with SyncToy. I am finally transitioning from laptop running Windows 7 to another laptop running Windows 10. The Windows 10 laptop previously had a hard drive failure and since it was mostly used for web browsing at that time, we replaced it with a small 128 GB drive so I store all files on external drive.

First issue: last May I set up fresh Thunderbird folder, renaming the bulky previous folder and didn't find out until last week that both folders stopped saving to the Thunderbird folder 5/22/2022, almost a year ago. Today is 5/08/2023.

Resulting in related issue on Windows 10 laptop: When I started dragging new emails into local folders, I found that no Local Folder has a date more recent than 5/22/2022. Went back to Windows 7 laptop and all the recently saved emails are in Local Folders.

When checking storage, Windows 7 showed as being in C:\Users\Name\AppData\Thunderbird\Roaming\Profiles\ default I'm guessing it was inadvertently changed. So I made new folder syncing the AppData folder with the Documents/Thunderbird folder and copied it to the Windows 10 AppData Thunderbird folder, then set it as the local storage folder. STILL have no recently saved emails in Local Folders. I went back and followed the instructions on this link as well: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

I've synced and copied several sets of folders to no avail. I KNOW the emails exist on the Windows 7 laptop but I cannot find where or how to save or transfer emails from May 2022 to May 2023. What am I missing?

One thing I can't quite understand is that Account Settings\ Copies & Folders archives options shows Local Folders on drop down list also showing archives on the 3 email accounts I download into Thunderbird but it will NOT let me choose Local Folders. None are grayed out but the Local option is simply not allowed. This is true on both laptops.

Thanks in advance for any help in something that is normally so easy. Anne J
creator: AnneJ

title: Quick Filtering for Unread emails does not update the view in real time
content:
Hi dears,

I always use Thunderbird with the Quick Filter set to "Unread" messages.

When I delete an unread email, it disappears right away from the view, however when I mark an unread email as "Read" it stays there along with all other "Unread" emails: why doesn't it disappear (since I'm filtering for "Unread" emails and it is a "Read" one now)?

Thanks a lot for your time!
creator: Matteo
